page.title: 13H.M.Prison,Highpoint
page.content: H.M.Prison,Highpoint,a category'C' prison,was built between 1972 and 1977 on the site of the former R.A.F. station at Stradishall.It was extended in 1983.The site consists of 155acres,one-third of which is built on. Cells are occupied by 1,2, or 4 prisoners.There are several different buildings within the prison complex, including a gym,chapel,education dept.hospital,library,T.V. room and dining-room.Prisoners can learn tailoring,building and plumbing in special workshops. As this is a category 'C' prison,the offences committed by the prisoners are usually burglary or drug abuse.The average sentence is two years. The building is to be extended next year,to hold 810 men instead of 600 at present.
